column2: Access:                                 https://doi.org/10.5962/bhl.title.115277Availability:                           Check the catalogs in your library. Libraries worldwide that own item: 26 Search the HOLLIS CatalogExternal Resources:                     Cite This ItemFind Items About:                       New voyage round the world4Dampier, William,max: 717Cowley, William Ambrosia,7Hacke, William,15Halley, Edmond,max: 504Robert, A.,max: 79Sharpe,Bartholomew,max: 164Wafer, Lionel,max: 48Wood, John,835Title:                                   Nouveau voyage autour du monde. :Où l'on décrit en particulier l'Istme de l'Amerique, plusieurs côtes & isles des Indes occidentales, les isles du Cap Verd, le passage par la Terre del Fuego, les côtes meridiolales [sic] deChili, du Perou, & du Mexique; l'Isle de Guam, Mindanao, & des autres Philippines; les isles orientales qui sont prés [sic] de Cambodie, de la Chine, Formosa, Luc̦on, Celebes, &c. La NouvelleHollande, les Isles de Sumatra, de Nicobar, de Sainte Helene & le Cap de Bonne Esperance. Où l'on traite des differens terroirs de tous ces païs, de leurs ports, des plantes, des fruits, & desanimaux qu'on y trouve: de leurs habitans, de leurs coûtumes, de leur religion, de leur gouvernement, de leur negoce &c.Uniform Title:                          New voyage round the world.Author(s):                              Dampier, William, 1651-1715,  creator.Cowley, William Ambrosia, ; contributor.; Voyage round the globeDampier, William,; 1651-1715, ; contributor.; Discourse of the trade-winds, breezes, storms, seasons of the year, tides and currents of the torrid zone throughout the world.Dampier, William,; 1651-1715, ; contributor.; Voyage from Achin in Sumatra, to Tonquin, and other places in the East Indies.Dampier, William,; 1651-1715, ; contributor.; Voyages to the Bay of Campeachy.Hacke, William, ; contributor.Halley, Edmond,; 1656-1742, ; contributor.Robert, A., zoologist, ; contributor.; Voyage to the LevantRobert, A.,; 17th cent- ; contributor.; Voyage to the LevantSharpe, Bartholomew,; active 1679-1682, ; contributor.; Journal of his expedition.Wafer, Lionel,; 1660?-1705?, ; contributor.; New voyage and description of the Isthmus of America.Wood, John,; Captain, ; contributor.; Voyage thro' the Streights of Magellan.Publication:                            A Rouen : Chez Jean-Baptiste Machuel, ruë Etoupée,Year:                                   1723Description:                            1 online resourceLanguage:                               FrenchStandard No:                            LCCN:                                   05-39310Access:                                 Materials specified:                    Biodiversity Heritage Libraryhttps://doi.org/10.5962/bhl.title.115277Materials specified:                    Biodiversity Heritage Libraryhttps://www.biodiversitylibrary.org/bibliography/115277SUBJECT(S)Descriptor:                             Buccaneers.Description and travel.Discovery and exploration.Imprint 1723.Natural history.Ocean currents.Tides.Voyages and travels.Voyages around the world.Winds.Genre/Form:                             book.Geographic:                             Australia.Cabo Verde.Campeche, Bay of (Mexico)Canary Islands.East Indies.Indonesia.Latin America.Magellan, Strait of (Chile and Argentina)Mexico.Middle East.Pacific Ocean.Papua New Guinea.Salvador (Brazil)Shark Bay (W.A.)West Indies.Note(s):                                "Journal de l'expedition du Capitaine Sharp", p. 212-251, 2nd count, has separate caption title./ "Suite du Voyage de Guillaume Dampier aux terres australes,à la Nouvelles Hollande, &c. fait en 1699", p. 1-166, 2nd count, has separate caption title./ "Suplement [sic] du Voyage autour du monde" is a translation of parts 1 and 2 of: Voyages anddescriptions, first printed London, 1699, which comprises volume 2 of the author's A new voyage round the world, and which was first printed in French in 1701; wanting part 3 entitled "Traité desvents alisez ou reglez, des vents frais de mer & de terre, des tempêtes, des saisons de l'année, des marées, & de courans de toute la zone torride" which is a translation of "Discourse of thetrade-winds, breezes, storms, seasons of the year, tides and currents of the torrid zone throughout the world" and is here printed at the end of vol. 2 in this collection./ "Traité des vents alisezou reglez, des vents frais de mer & de terre, des tempêtes, des saisons de l'année, des marées, & de courans de toute la zone torride", v. 2, p. [273]-396, 2nd count, has divisional title page.This is a translation of "Discourse of the trade-winds, breezes, storms, seasons of the year, tides and currents of the torrid zone throughout the world", which first appeared as part 3 in theauthor's New voyage round the world, vol. 2, first printed London, 1699 under title: "Voyages and descriptions"/ "Voyage aux terres australes a la Nouvelle Hollande, &c. fait en M. DC. XCIX" is atranslation of "A voyage to New Holland, &c. in the year 1699" first printed London, 1703 and first printed in French by Paul Marret, Amsterdam 1705; This work, without the addition of Wafer's A newvoyage and description of the Isthmus of America, comprises vol. 3 of the author's A new voyage round the world./ "Voyage aux terres australes, a la Nouvelle Hollande, &c." is a translation of "Acontinuation of a voyage to New-Holland, &c. in the year 1699" first printed London, 1709 and first printed in French by Paul Marret, Amsterdam 1711./ "Voyage de Guillaume Dampier, aux terresaustrales, a la Nouvelle Hollande, &c fait en 1699", v. 4, p. [1]-146, 1st count, has a preface written by Edmund Halley on p. 16-20, 1st count./ "Voyage de Mr. Wafer, où l'on trouve la descriptionde l'Istme [sic] de l'Amerique", p. [147]-381, has divisional title page, and is a translation of "A new voyage and description of the Isthmus of America" first printed London, 1699./ "Voyage duCapitaine Cowley autour du monde", p. [253]-302, 2nd count, has divisional title page./ "Voyage du Capitaine Vood [sic] à travers le détroit de Magellan, &c.", p. 167-211, 2nd count, has separatecaption title./ "Voyage du Levant de Mr. Robert", p. [303]-363, 2nd count, has divisional title page./ A collected issue, with additions, of William Dampier's voyages, first printed in English infour separate volumes, London, 1697 to 1709, and first printed in four separate volumes in French, Amsterdam by Paul Marret, 1698-1705./ Alden, J.E. European Americana, 723/41./ Approbation andprivilege for collection: v. 5, p. [24-25], 3rd count./ Includes indexes./ Leclerc, C. Bib. Americana (1878), 161./ Leclerc, C. Bib. Americana, 417./ Pagination: v. 1: [14], 408, [24] p., [8] leavesof plates (5 folded); v. 2: [6], 396, [10] p., [9] leaves of plates (4 folded); v. 3: [8], 393, [11] p., [8] leaves of plates (6 folded); v. 4: 20, 381, [15] p., [18] leaves of plates (6 folded); v.5: [4], 363, [25] p., [19] leaves of plates (5 folded)./ Signatures: v. 1: pi² (pi1 recto, pi2 verso blank) ẽ⁶ (-ẽ6) (ẽ1 missigned ã1) A-S¹² (S12 verso blank); v. 2: pi⁴ (-pi4) (pi1recto, pi2 verso blank) A-Q¹² (M5 verso blank) R¹² (-R12); v. 3: pi1 (pi1 verso blank) ẽ⁴ (-ẽ4) (ẽ1 missigned ã1) A-Q¹² R¹⁰; v. 4: pi1 (pi1 verso blank) ã4 (-ã4) ẽ⁶ A-Q¹²(G2 verso blank) R⁶ (R6 verso blank); v. 5: pi² (pi1 verso blank) A-Q¹² (E3 missigned L3) (L7, N8 versos blank) R²./ The first collected French edition was printed in Amsterdam by Paul Marretfrom 1711-1712./ The translations of the voyages of Wood, Sharpe, Cowley, and Roberts included in vol. 5 are from A collection of original voyages / edited by William Hacke, first printed London,1699 and are additions to Dampier's A new voyage round round the world, vols. I-IV./ This collected edition is a reprint of the Rouen, Jean-Baptiste Machuel edition of 1715. Cf. Sabin./ Title page ofvol. 2 reads: "Suite du voyage autour du monde. Avec un Traité des vents qui régnent dans toute la zone torride" and has identical imprint as that of title page of vol. 1./ Title page of vol. 3reads: "Suplement [sic] du Voyage autour du monde. Contenant une description d'Achin, ville de Sumatra, du royaume de Tonquin & autres places des Indes, & de la Baye de Campeche. Enrichi de cartes &figures" and has identical imprint as that of title page of vol. 1./ Title page of vol. 4 reads: "Voyage aux terres australes, a la Nouvelle Hollande, &c. fait en M. DC. XCIX. Où l'on trouve ladescription des Isles Canaries, des isles de Mayo & de Saint Jago, de la Baye de Tous les Saints, des forts & de la ville de Bahia dans le Bresil, &c. Par Guillaume Dampier. Avec le voyage de LionelWafer, où l'on trouve la description de l'Isthme de Darien dans l'Amerique, &c." and has identical imprint as that of title page of vol. 1./ Title page of vol. 5 reads: "Voyage aux terresaustrales, a la Nouvelle Hollande, &c. Où l'on a joint I. Le voyage du Capitaine Vood [sic] à travers le détroit de Magellan, &c. II. Le journal de l'expedition du Capitaine Sharp. III. Levoyage autour du monde du Capitaine Cowley. IV. Le voyage du Levant de Mr. Robert. Avec divers cartes & figures. Par Guillaume Dampier" and has identical imprint as that of title page of vol. 1./Title pages printed in red and black; woodcut head and tail pieces; initials./ Volume 2, part 1, p. 1-272, 2nd count, continues the author's Nouveau voyage autour du monde, vol. 1, first printed inEnglish, 1697 and first printed in two volumes in French in Amsterdam, 1698./ Volumes 1 and 2 have added, illustrated title pages reading: Voyage au tour [sic] du monde.General Info:                           Other format available:                 Print version:Other Titles:                           Voyage autour du monde.Vendor Info:                            Biodiversity Heritage Library (BHL1)Material Type:                          Document (dct); Internet resource (url); eBook (ebk)Document Type:                          Internet Resource; Computer FileDate of Entry:                          20190910Update:                                 20211231Accession No:                           OCLC:                                   1126092729Provider:        OCLCDatabase:                               WorldCat--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Nouveau voyage autour du monde. -- T. 2. Suite du Voyage autour du monde. Avec un traité des vents qui régnent dans toute la zone torride. -- T. 3.Supplement du Voyage autour du monde. Contenant une description d'Achin, ville de Sumatra, du royaume de Tonquin, & autres places des Indes, & de la baye de Campêche. -- T. 4. Voyage aux terresaustrales, a la Nouvelle Hollande, &c. fait en M. DC. XCIX ... Avec le voyage de Lionel Wafer. Où l'on trouve la description de l'isthme de Darien dans l'Amerique, &c. -- T. 5. Voyage aux terresaustrales a la Nouvelle Hollande, &c. Ou l'on a joint I. Le voyage du capitaine Wood, à travers le detroit de Magellan, &c. II. Le journal de l'expedition du capitaine Sharp. III. Le voyage autourdu monde du capitaine Cowley. IV. Libraries worldwide that own item: 1 Search the HOLLIS CatalogExternal Resources:                     Cite This ItemFind Items About:                       Didot,58Title:                                   Histoire générale des voyages, ou, Nouvelle collection de toutes les relations de voyages par mer et par terre, qui ont été publiées jusqu'à présentdans les différentes langues de toutes les nations connues :ce qui'il y a de plus remarquable, de plus utile et de mieux averé dans les pays ou les voyageurs ont penetré, avec les moeurs des habitans, la religion, les usages, arts, sciences, commerce,manufactures, &c, pour former un systême complet d'histoire & de géographie moderne, qui représente l'état actuel de toutes les nations : enrichi de cartes géographiques et de figures; Tomesixiéme.Uniform Title:                          Histoire générale des voyages (Paris, 1746-89, 80 v., 12º), Tome 6.Author(s):                              Prévost, Antoine-François 1697-1763Didot,; (Paris) ; imp.Publication:                            Paris : Chez Didot,Place:                                  Francia; Paris.Year:                                   1747Description:                            [4], 434 p., 6 h. de grab. (3 pleg.): il ; 12º (17 cm.)In:                                     Histoire générale des voyages (Paris, 1746-89, 80 v., 12º), Obra completa.Language:                               FrenchAccess:                                 http://books.google.com/books/ucm?vid=UCM5314301484&printsec=frontcover Note:                                   VersiÃ³n electrÃ³nica Google repr. parcialhttp://hdl.handle.net/2027/ucm.5314301484 Note:                                   VersiÃ³n electrÃ³nica Google repr. parcialSUBJECT(S)Descriptor:                             Literatura de viajesViajes -- Antologías.Geographic:                             Canarias -- Descripción -- HistoriaNote(s):                                Premiere partie, Livre quatriéme, Premiers voyages des anglois aux indes orientales enterpris par une compagnie de Marchands. - Premiere partie, Livrecinquiéme, Voyages en différentes parties de l'Afrique & dans les isles adjacentes, avec la description des pays & des habitants (Description des isles Canaries...). Blathwayt atlas. [1629-1683]. map 26 of 48Language:                               FrenchReferences:                             List of maps of America in the Library of Congress; p. 1053; Black, J. Blathwayt atlas; a collection of 48 manuscript and printed maps of the 17th centuryrelating to the British overseas empire in that era, brought together about 1683 for the use of the Lords of Trade and Plantations,; 26SUBJECT(S)Genre/Form:                             Maps.Geographic:                             Florida -- Maps.Bahamas -- Maps.Antilles, Greater -- Maps.Windward Islands (West Indies) -- Maps.Central America -- Maps.Colombia -- Maps.Venezuela -- Maps.Caribbean Area -- Maps.Bahamas.Caribbean Area.Central America.Colombia.Florida.Venezuela.West Indies -- Greater Antilles.Windward Islands.Map Info:                               Scale [ca. 1:6,000,000].; (W 84°00'00"--W 58°20'00"/N 29°00'00"--N 9°50'00").Cartgraph Code:                         Category of scale:                      a Constant ratio linear horizontal scale: 6000000 West longitude:                         W0840000 East longitude:                        W0582000 North latitude:                         N0290000 South latitude:                         N0095000Note(s):                                Title of map from cartouche from upper right corner./ Imprint from cartouche./ Name of engraver from lower right hand corner of map./ The line Chez l'autheur"in imprint replaces an erased line of engraving, possibly beginning "Chez Pierre Mariette."/ Approximate scale calculuated from lines of latitude./ Relief shown pictorially./ The map shows SouthernFlorida and the Bahama Islands to parts of northern Colombia and Venezuela from north to south and from parts of Honduras, Nicaragua, and Costa Rica to the Lesser Antilles as far as part of Barbadoesfrom west to east./ This map is numbered as no. 24, i.e. 25, in John Povey's hand written index with title "A list of maps, as they ly bound in this book" which records the contents of the atlas asit was first made up about 1683, but numbered as 26 of 48 in Jeannette Black's "The Blathwayt atlas: a collection of 48 manuscript and printed maps of the 17th century relating to the Britishoverseas empire in that era, brought together about 1683 for the use of the Lords of Trade and Plantations."/ The Blathwayt Atlas is a composite atlas consisting of thirteen manuscript andthirty-five printed maps, from various sources, dating from 1629-1683, which were probably bound together around 1683, that were in use by the office of the Committee of the Lords of Trade andPlantations. William Blathwayt was connected to the office of the Committee for Trade and Plantations from 1675 to 1696 and served thereafter as a member of the Board of Trade untll 1710. He alsoheld the positions of surveyor and auditor general of the plantation revenues from 1680 until his death in 1717, and clerk of the Privy Council, Secretary of War, Secretary of State pro tem, and alsoserved as a member of Parliament. By the time of his death the maps in this atlas were mostly out of date and were not retained and so this composite atlas survived in his personal library./ For adetailed study of this map and of the Blathwayt Atlas, which includes the map facsimiles, and a commentary volume detailing each map in the Blathwayt atlas, as well as other states also recorded,please see "The Blathwayt atlas: a collection of 48 manuscript and printed maps of the 17th century relating to the British overseas empire in that era, brought together about 1683 for the use of theLords of Trade and Plantations" / by Jeannette Black, Providence, 1970-1975. Please note that the number assigned to the individually catalogued maps will conform to the numbering used by JeannetteBlack and not to the index originally bound with the volume.Class Descriptors:                       Dewey: Cabinet; Blathwayt; 26; Geographic:                             3931; 4800; 4910; 5000Other Titles:                           Isles Antilles etc.Responsibility:                         Par N. Sanson d'Abbeville geogr[aphe] ord[inai]re du roy. ; I. Somer sculpsit.Document Type:                          MapEntry:                                  20170728Update:                                 20220421Accession No:                           OCLC:                                   995355522Provider:        OCLCDatabase:                               WorldCat--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Avec la description de la ville de Mexique telle qu'elle estoit autrefois, & comme elle est à present.Ensemble vne description exacte des terres & provinces que possedent les Espagnols en toute l'Amerique, de la forme de leur gouvernement ecclesiastique & politique, de leur commerce, de leurs moeurs,& de celles de criolles, des metifs [sic], des mulatres, des indiens, & des negres. Et un traité de la langue poconchi ou pocomane. Dedié à Monseigneur Colbert secretaire d'etat. /Uniform Title:                          English-American. Libraries worldwide that own item: 2 Search the HOLLIS CatalogExternal Resources:                     Cite This ItemFind Items About:                       Dampier, William,max: 717Title:Nouveau voyage autour du monde /Author(s):                              Dampier, William, 1652-1715.Publication:                            Amsterdam : Marret,Year:                                   1711-1717Description:                            5 volumes : illustrations, cartesLanguage:                               FrenchContents:                               v. 1. Nouveau voyage autour du monde.- v. 2. Suite du Voyage autour du monde. Avec un traité des vents qui régnent dans toute la zone torride.- v. 3.Supplément du Voyage autour du monde. Contenant une description d'Achin, ville de Sumatra, du royaume de Tonquin, & autres places des Indes, & de la baye de Campêche.- v. 4. Voyage aux terresaustrales, à la Nouvelle Hollande, &c. fait en MDCXCIX. Avec le voyage de Lionel Wafer. Où l'on trouve la description de l'isthme de Darien dans l'Amérique, &c. -- v. 5. Voyage aux terresaustrales, a la Nouvelle Hollande, &c. Ou l'on a joint I. Le voyage du captaine Wood à travers le detroit de Magellan, &c. II. Le journal de l'expédition du captaine Sharp. III. Le voyage autourdu monde du capitaine Cowley. IV. Le voyage du Leuant de Mr. Robert.SUBJECT(S)Descriptor:                             Voyages around the world.Voyages and travels.Winds.Tides.WindVoyages autour du monde.Voyages.Vents.Marées.journeys.tides.Tides.Voyages and travels.Voyages around the world.Winds.Class Descriptors:                       Dewey: 910.41 D166Responsibility:                         par Guillaume Dampier.Document Type:                          BookEntry:                                  19810429Update:                                 20220323Accession No:                           OCLC:                                   319736887Provider:        OCLCDatabase:                               WorldCat--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

column2: Access:                                 https://archive.org/details/nouveauvoyageaut00dampAvailability:                           Check the catalogs in your library. Libraries worldwide that own item: 2 Search the HOLLIS CatalogExternal Resources:                     Cite This ItemFind Items About:                       New voyage round the world4Dampier, William,max: 717Halley, Edmond,max: 504Hacke, William.15Wafer, Lionel,max: 48Wood, John,835Sharpe, Bartholomew,max:164Cowley, William Ambrosia.7Robert, A.,max: 79Title:                                   Nouveau voyage autour du monde. :Où l'on décrit en particulier l'Istme de l'Amerique, plusieurs côtes & isles des Indes occidentales, les isles du Cap Verd, le passage par la Terre del Fuego, les côtes meridiolales [sic] deChili, du Perou, & du Mexique; l'Isle de Guam, Mindanao, & des autres Philippines; les isles orientales qui sont prés [sic] de Cambodie, de la Chine, Formosa, Luc̦on, Celebes, &c. La NouvelleHollande, les Isles de Sumatra, de Nicobar, de Sainte Helene & le Cap de Bonne Esperance. Où l'on traite des differens terroirs de tous ces païs, de leurs ports, des plantes, des fruits, & desanimaux qu'on y trouve: de leurs habitans, de leurs coûtumes, de leur religion, de leur gouvernement, de leur negoce &c. /Uniform Title:                          New voyage round the world. Descriptions et voyages.Asia -- East Indies.Atlantic Ocean -- Strait of Magellan.Australia.Brazil -- Salvador.Cabo Verde.Canary Islands.Gulf of Mexico -- Bay of Campeche.Indian Ocean -- Shark Bay.Indonesia.Latin America.Mexico.Middle East.Pacific Ocean.Papua New Guinea.West Indies.Identifier:                             Imprint 1723.Note(s):                                A collected issue, with additions, of William Dampier's voyages, first printed in English in four separate volumes, London, 1697 to 1709, and first printed infour separate volumes in French, Amsterdam by Paul Marret, 1698-1705./ The first collected French edition was printed in Amsterdam by Paul Marret from 1711-1712./ This collected edition is a reprintof the Rouen, Jean-Baptiste Machuel edition of 1715. Cf. Sabin./ Volumes 1 and 2 have added, illustrated title pages reading: Voyage au tour [sic] du monde./ Title page of vol. 2 reads: "Suite duvoyage autour du monde. Avec un Traité des vents qui régnent dans toute la zone torride" and has identical imprint as that of title page of vol. 1./ Volume 2, part 1, p. 1-272, 2nd count,continues the author's Nouveau voyage autour du monde, vol. 1, first printed in English, 1697 and first printed in two volumes in French in Amsterdam, 1698./ "Traité des vents alisez ou reglez, desvents frais de mer & de terre, des tempêtes, des saisons de l'année, des marées, & de courans de toute la zone torride", v. 2, p. [273]-396, 2nd count, has divisional title page. This is atranslation of "Discourse of the trade-winds, breezes, storms, seasons of the year, tides and currents of the torrid zone throughout the world", which first appeared as part 3 in the author's Newvoyage round the world, vol. 2, first printed London, 1699 under title: "Voyages and descriptions"/ Title page of vol. 3 reads: "Suplement [sic] du Voyage autour du monde. Contenant une descriptiond'Achin, ville de Sumatra, du royaume de Tonquin & autres places des Indes, & de la Baye de Campeche. Enrichi de cartes & figures" and has identical imprint as that of title page of vol. 1./"Suplement [sic] du Voyage autour du monde" is a translation of parts 1 and 2 of: Voyages and descriptions, first printed London, 1699, which comprises volume 2 of the author's A new voyage round theworld, and which was first printed in French in 1701; wanting part 3 entitled "Traité des vents alisez ou reglez, des vents frais de mer & de terre, des tempêtes, des saisons de l'année, desmarées, & de courans de toute la zone torride" which is a translation of "Discourse of the trade-winds, breezes, storms, seasons of the year, tides and currents of the torrid zone throughout theworld" and is here printed at the end of vol. 2 in this collection./ Title page of vol. 4 reads: "Voyage aux terres australes, a la Nouvelle Hollande, &c. fait en M. DC. XCIX. Où l'on trouve ladescription des Isles Canaries, des isles de Mayo & de Saint Jago, de la Baye de Tous les Saints, des forts & de la ville de Bahia dans le Bresil, &c. Par Guillaume Dampier. Avec le voyage de LionelWafer, où l'on trouve la description de l'Isthme de Darien dans l'Amerique, &c." and has identical imprint as that of title page of vol. 1./ "Voyage aux terres australes a la Nouvelle Hollande, &c.fait en M. DC. XCIX" is a translation of "A voyage to New Holland, &c. in the year 1699" first printed London, 1703 and first printed in French by Paul Marret, Amsterdam 1705; This work, without theaddition of Wafer's A new voyage and description of the Isthmus of America, comprises vol. 3 of the author's A new voyage round the world./ "Voyage de Guillaume Dampier, aux terres australes, a laNouvelle Hollande, & c fait en 1699", v. 4, p. [1]-146, 1st count, has a preface written by Edmund Halley on p. 16-20, 1st count/ "Voyage de Mr. Wafer, où l'on trouve la description de l'Istme[sic] de l'Amerique", p. [147]-381, has divisional title page, and is a translation of "A new voyage and description of the Isthmus of America" first printed London, 1699./ Title page of vol. 5reads: "Voyage aux terres australes, a la Nouvelle Hollande, &c. Où l'on a joint I. Le voyage du Capitaine Vood [sic] à travers le détroit de Magellan, &c. II. Le journal de l'expedition duCapitaine Sharp. III. Le voyage autour du monde du Capitaine Cowley. IV. Le voyage du Levant de Mr. Robert. Avec divers cartes & figures. Par Guillaume Dampier" and has identical imprint as that oftitle page of vol. 1./ "Voyage aux terres australes, a la Nouvelle Hollande, &c." is a translation of "A continuation of a voyage to New-Holland, &c. in the year 1699" first printed London, 1709 andfirst printed in French by Paul Marret, Amsterdam 1711/ The translations of the voyages of Wood, Sharpe, Cowley, and Roberts included in vol. 5 are from A collection of original voyages / edited byWilliam Hacke, first printed London, 1699 and are additions to Dampier's A new voyage round round the world, vols. I-IV./ "Suite du Voyage de Guillaume Dampier aux terres australes, à la NouvellesHollande, &c. fait en 1699", p. 1-166, 2nd count, has separate caption title./ "Voyage du Capitaine Vood [sic] à travers le détroit de Magellan, &c.", p. 167-211, 2nd count, has separate captiontitle./ "Journal de l'expedition du Capitaine Sharp", p. 212-251, 2nd count, has separate caption title/ "Voyage du Capitaine Cowley autour du monde", p. [253]-302, 2nd count, has divisional titlepage/ "Voyage du Levant de Mr. Robert", p. [303]-363, 2nd count, has divisional title page/ Approbation and privilege for collection: v. 5, p. [24-25], 3rd count./ Pagination: v. 1: [14], 408, [24]p., [8] leaves of plates (5 folded); v. 2: [6], 396, [10] p., [9] leaves of plates (4 folded); v. 3: [8], 393, [11] p., [8] leaves of plates (6 folded); v. 4: 20, 381, [15] p., [18] leaves of plates(6 folded); v. 5: [4], 363, [25] p., [19] leaves of plates (5 folded)./ Signatures: v. 1: pi² (pi1 recto, pi2 verso blank) ẽ⁶ (-ẽ6) (ẽ1 missigned ã1) A-S¹² (S12 verso blank); v. 2: pi⁴(-pi4) (pi1 recto, pi2 verso blank) A-Q¹² (M5 verso blank) R¹² (-R12); v. 3: pi1 (pi1 verso blank) ẽ⁴ (-ẽ4) (ẽ1 missigned ã1) A-Q¹² R¹⁰; v. 4: pi1 (pi1 verso blank) ã4 (-ã4)ẽ⁶ A-Q¹² (G2 verso blank) R⁶ (R6 verso blank); v. 5: pi² (pi1 verso blank) A-Q¹² (E3 missigned L3) (L7, N8 versos blank) R²/ Includes indexes./ Title pages printed in red and black;woodcut head and tail pieces; initials./ Digital version available on Internet Archive.Class Descriptors:                       Dewey: D723Other Titles:                           Voyage autour du mondeResponsibility:                         Par Guillaume Dampier. Enrichi de cartes & figures.Material Type:                          Internet resource (url)Document Type:                          Book; Internet ResourceDate of Entry:                          20110629Update:                                 20220411Accession No:                           OCLC:                                   1238115954Provider:        OCLCDatabase:                               WorldCat--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Cf. Sabin./ Volumes 1 and 2 have added, illustrated title pages reading: Voyage au tour [sic] du monde./ Title page of vol. 2 reads: "Suite duvoyage autour du monde. Avec un Traité des vents qui régnent dans toute la zone torride" and has identical imprint as that of title page of vol. 1./ Volume 2, part 1, p. 1-272, 2nd count,continues the author's Nouveau voyage autour du monde, vol. 1, first printed in English, 1697 and first printed in two volumes in French in Amsterdam, 1698./ "Traité des vents alisez ou reglez, desvents frais de mer & de terre, des tempêtes, des saisons de l'année, des marées, & de courans de toute la zone torride", v. 2, p. [273]-396, 2nd count, has divisional title page. This is atranslation of "Discourse of the trade-winds, breezes, storms, seasons of the year, tides and currents of the torrid zone throughout the world", which first appeared as part 3 in the author's Newvoyage round the world, vol. 2, first printed London, 1699 under title: "Voyages and descriptions"/ Title page of vol. 3 reads: "Suplement [sic] du Voyage autour du monde. Contenant une descriptiond'Achin, ville de Sumatra, du royaume de Tonquin & autres places des Indes, & de la Baye de Campeche. Enrichi de cartes & figures" and has identical imprint as that of title page of vol. 1./"Suplement [sic] du Voyage autour du monde" is a translation of parts 1 and 2 of: Voyages and descriptions, first printed London, 1699, which comprises volume 2 of the author's A new voyage round theworld, and which was first printed in French in 1701; wanting part 3 entitled "Traité des vents alisez ou reglez, des vents frais de mer & de terre, des tempêtes, des saisons de l'année, desmarées, & de courans de toute la zone torride" which is a translation of "Discourse of the trade-winds, breezes, storms, seasons of the year, tides and currents of the torrid zone throughout theworld" and is here printed at the end of vol. 2 in this collection./ Title page of vol. 4 reads: "Voyage aux terres australes, a la Nouvelle Hollande, &c. fait en M. DC. XCIX. Où l'on trouve ladescription des Isles Canaries, des isles de Mayo & de Saint Jago, de la Baye de Tous les Saints, des forts & de la ville de Bahia dans le Bresil, &c. Par Guillaume Dampier. Avec le voyage de LionelWafer, où l'on trouve la description de l'Isthme de Darien dans l'Amerique, &c." and has identical imprint as that of title page of vol. 1./ "Voyage aux terres australes a la Nouvelle Hollande, &c.fait en M. DC. XCIX" is a translation of "A voyage to New Holland, &c. in the year 1699" first printed London, 1703 and first printed in French by Paul Marret, Amsterdam 1705; This work, without theaddition of Wafer's A new voyage and description of the Isthmus of America, comprises vol. 3 of the author's A new voyage round the world./ "Voyage de Guillaume Dampier, aux terres australes, a laNouvelle Hollande, & c fait en 1699", v. 4, p. [1]-146, 1st count, has a preface written by Edmund Halley on p. 16-20, 1st count/ "Voyage de Mr. Wafer, où l'on trouve la description de l'Istme[sic] de l'Amerique", p. [147]-381, has divisional title page, and is a translation of "A new voyage and description of the Isthmus of America" first printed London, 1699./ Title page of vol. 5reads: "Voyage aux terres australes, a la Nouvelle Hollande, &c. Où l'on a joint I. Le voyage du Capitaine Vood [sic] à travers le détroit de Magellan, &c. II. Le journal de l'expedition duCapitaine Sharp. III. Le voyage autour du monde du Capitaine Cowley. IV. Le voyage du Levant de Mr. Robert. Avec divers cartes & figures. Par Guillaume Dampier" and has identical imprint as that oftitle page of vol. 1./ "Voyage aux terres australes, a la Nouvelle Hollande, &c." is a translation of "A continuation of a voyage to New-Holland, &c. in the year 1699" first printed London, 1709 andfirst printed in French by Paul Marret, Amsterdam 1711/ The translations of the voyages of Wood, Sharpe, Cowley, and Roberts included in vol. 5 are from A collection of original voyages / edited byWilliam Hacke, first printed London, 1699 and are additions to Dampier's A new voyage round round the world, vols. I-IV./ "Suite du Voyage de Guillaume Dampier aux terres australes, à la NouvellesHollande, &c. fait en 1699", p. 1-166, 2nd count, has separate caption title./ "Voyage du Capitaine Vood [sic] à travers le détroit de Magellan, &c.", p. 167-211, 2nd count, has separate captiontitle./ "Journal de l'expedition du Capitaine Sharp", p. 212-251, 2nd count, has separate caption title/ "Voyage du Capitaine Cowley autour du monde", p. [253]-302, 2nd count, has divisional titlepage/ "Voyage du Levant de Mr. Robert", p. [303]-363, 2nd count, has divisional title page/ Approbation and privilege for collection: v. 5, p. [24-25], 3rd count./ Pagination: v. 1: [14], 408, [24]p., [8] leaves of plates (5 folded); v. 2: [6], 396, [10] p., [9] leaves of plates (4 folded); v. 3: [8], 393, [11] p., [8] leaves of plates (6 folded); v. 4: 20, 381, [15] p., [18] leaves of plates(6 folded); v. 5: [4], 363, [25] p., [19] leaves of plates (5 folded)./ Signatures: v. 1: pi² (pi1 recto, pi2 verso blank) ẽ⁶ (-ẽ6) (ẽ1 missigned ã1) A-S¹² (S12 verso blank); v. 2: pi⁴(-pi4) (pi1 recto, pi2 verso blank) A-Q¹² (M5 verso blank) R¹² (-R12); v. 3: pi1 (pi1 verso blank) ẽ⁴ (-ẽ4) (ẽ1 missigned ã1) A-Q¹² R¹⁰; v. 4: pi1 (pi1 verso blank) ã4 (-ã4)ẽ⁶ A-Q¹² (G2 verso blank) R⁶ (R6 verso blank); v. 5: pi² (pi1 verso blank) A-Q¹² (E3 missigned L3) (L7, N8 versos blank) R²/ Includes indexes./ Title pages printed in red and black;woodcut head and tail pieces; initials./ Digital version available on Internet Archive.

Libraries worldwide that own item: 1 Search the HOLLIS CatalogExternal Resources:                     Cite This ItemFind Items About:                       New voyage round the world4Dampier, William,max: 717Title:Nouveau voyage autour du monde, òu l'on décrit en particulier l'isthme de l'Amerique ... /Uniform Title:                          New voyage round the world. FrenchAuthor(s):                              Dampier, William, 1651-1715.Publication:                            A Amsterdam : Chez Paul Marret,Year:                                   1701, 1705Description:                            volumes : illustrations, maps ; 17 cm ; 12moLanguage:                               FrenchSUBJECT(S)Descriptor:                             Voyages around the world.Voyages autour du monde.Voyages around the world.Note(s):                                Volume two - the "Traité des vents" has seperate title page, pagination and signatures and lacks all after p.48; volume four - pagination slightlyirregular./ Titles vary. Volume two is titled "Suite du voyage autour du monde; avec un traité des vents qui regnent dans toute la zone torride"; volume three is titled "Suplement du voyage autourdu monde" and continues "contenant une description d'Achin, ville de Sumatra, du royaume de Tonquin & autres places des Indes, & de la Baye de Campéche. Ou il est traité des differens terroirs detous ces pais, de leurs ports, des plantes, des fruits ... [etc.]"; volume four is titled "Voyage de Guillaume Dampier ..." and continues "où l'on trouve la description des isles Canaries, desisles de Mayo & de S. Jago ... avec le Voyage de Lionel Wafer ..."Other Titles:                           Voyage de Guillaume Dampier.; Suite du voyage autour du monde.; Suplement du voyage autour du monde.Responsibility:                         par Guillaume Dampier .. ; traduit de l'anglois.Document Type:                          BookEntry:                                  20200818Update:                                 20220402Accession No:                           OCLC:                                   1184158510Provider:        OCLCDatabase:                               WorldCat--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

FrenchAuthor(s):                              Dampier, William, 1651-1715.Wood, John,; Captain.Wafer, Lionel,; 1660?-1705?Sharpe, Bartholomew,; active 1679-1682.Cowley, William Ambrosia.Roberts, A.,; active 17th century.Publication:                            A Amsterdam : Chez la veuve de Paul Marret ...,Year:                                   1711Description:                            5 volumes : illustrations, maps ; 17 cm (12mo)Language:                               FrenchContents:                               t. 1 Nouveau voyage autour du monde -- t. 2 Suite de Voyage autour du monde. Avec un traité des vents que régnent dans toute la zone torride -- t. 3Supplement du Voyage autour du monde. Contenant une description d'Achin, ville de Sumatra, du royaume de Tonquin & autres places des Indes, & de la Baye de Campêche -- t. 4. Voyage aux terresaustrales, a la Nouvelle Hollande, &c. fait en 1699 : où l'on trouve la description des Isles Canaries, des Isles de Mayo & de S. Jago, de la Baye de Tous les Saints, des forts & de la ville deBahia dans le Bresil, &c. Avec le voyage de Lionel VVafer. Où l'on trouve la description de l'isthme de Darien dans l'Amérique, & c -- t. 5 Voyage aux terres australes, a la Nouvelle Hollande, &c ... Où l'on a joint I. Le voyage du capitaine Wood à travers le detroit de Magellan, &c. II. Le journal de l'expedition du capitaine Sharp. III. Le voyage autour du monde du capitaine Cowley.IV. Libraries worldwide that own item: 1 Search the HOLLIS CatalogExternal Resources:                     Cite This ItemFind Items About:                       Harris, Joseph,max: 118Title:                                   Extrait d'une lettre ... dattée de Pondichera, au mois de Fevier 1711, et inserée dans l'onzieme Recueil des Lettres edifiantes ... :1711-1732.Author(s):                              Jaillandier, Père?Harris, Joseph,; 1704-1764.Carbone, João Baptista.Year:                                   1711-1732Description:                            Originals : 30 pages ; 26 cm Copies : partial microfilm reel (23 exposures) : negative (Rich. 101:3) and positiveLanguage:                               FrenchAbstract:                               A collection of five items, extracts, translations, and notes, in French, relating to New Spain, and including: 1) Jaillandier, Extrait d'une lettre ...Pondicherry, February, 1711, describing a trip from Buena Vista to Acapulco; 2) Extrait d'une Lettre ... Campeche, December 5, 1731, published in June, 1732, in the Gazette de Hollande, concerningconflict between the Spaniards and the English in Yucatán; 3) [Campagne d'Ursúa. n.p., n.d.], A description of Governor Ursúa's campaign, ca. 1697, against the Itza Indians, which resulted inopening a highway between Yucatán and Guatemala; 4) Observations Astronomiques, made by Joseph Harris, Veracruz, January-March, 1728, and João Baptista Carbone, Lisbon, 1726, apparentlytranslated from "Transactions filosofiques," January, February, and March, 1728SUBJECT(S)Descriptor:                             English -- Yucatan.English.Travel.Named Person:                           Ursúa.Geographic:                             America -- Description and travel.Amérique -- Descriptions et voyages.America.Note(s):                                Cont. 5) Chemin de la Vera Cruz a Guaxaca [n.p., n.d.] a list of sites on the Veracruz-Oaxaca road, with explanatory annotations./ Entered by Bancroft under"Jaillandier, P."; the initial is presumably the abbreviation for "Père."/ Also available on microfilm.General Info:                           Forms part of the Hubert Howe Bancroft Collection.Other Titles:                           Hubert Howe Bancroft collection.Material Type:                          Manuscript (mss)Document Type:                          Book; Archival MaterialDate of Entry:                          19920916Update:                                 20220605Accession No:                           OCLC:                                   215307308Provider:        OCLCDatabase:                               WorldCat--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Où il est traité des differens terroirs tous ce pais, de leursports, des plantes, des fruits, & des animaux qu'on y trouve: de leurs habitans, de leurs coûtumes, de leur religion, de leur gouvernement, de leur negoce &c. column2: Availability:                           Check the catalogs in your library. Libraries worldwide that own item: 1 Search the HOLLIS CatalogExternal Resources:                     Cite This ItemFind Items About:                       Chasles, M.max: 44Title:                                   [Documents on French colonial Louisiana, Acadia, the Antilles, and the Yucatan],[ca. 1760].Author(s):                              Malesherbes, Chrétien Guillaume de Lamoignon de, 1721-1794.Chasles, M.; 1793-1880, ; (Michel),; former owner.Corp Author(s):                         Rudy Lamont Ruggles Collection (Newberry Library)Year:                                   1760Description:                            [2], 181 leaves, bound ; 24 cm. (4to)Language:                               French; In French.Abstract:                               Six documents on French colonial Louisiana and other parts of America during the years 1729-1755, collected by Malesherbes, and transcribed by his secretariesfrom the original unpublished mss., probably around 1760. "Journal des operations ..." (leaves 1-76), recounts Régis du Roulet's journey (1729-1733) to the Choctaw country around Mobile, undertakenat the request of Etienne de Périer, commandant general of Louisiana, supposedly to rid the Choctaw villages of English traders. In fact, Périer really wanted the Choctaws to trade with him inNew Orleans rather than with the commandant at Mobile, Diron d'Artaguiette. The anonymous "Voyage de la Louisiane dans l'interieur ..." (leaves 84-142), documents a visit to Indian villages aroundMobile between Apr.-Aug. of 1732, and includes a census of the villages, their chiefs, and the number of warriors in each village. "Journal historique des hostilités commités par les angloiscontre las acadiens francois" (leaves 144-149), and "Addition au journal de M. Daudin, missionnaire d'Annapolis Royal ..." (leaves 156-162), by the abbé Daudin, detail the unjust treatment of theAcadians by their British conquerors between 1754 and 1755. "Extrait d'une conversation avec M. du Pavillon sur les Antilles" (leaves 172-173), is an excerpt from Malesherbes' conversation with acertain M. du Pavillon about the economic situation of the Antilles. Finally, "Deduction du droit que pretendent avoir les anglois de naviguer a la Baye de Campeche ..." (leaves 174-180), describesthe consequences for the French if the English, now engaged in cutting wood along the Mexican coast in the Bay of Campeche, and in Laguna de Terminos, were to establish a trading settlement in theYucatan.References:                             Lamoignon-Malesherbes, C.-G. Catalogue des livres,; no. 4815; Maggs Bros. Bibliotheca americana (1925),; no. 3016SUBJECT(S)Descriptor:                             Choctaw Indians -- Government relations -- History -- 18th century.Indians of North America -- Louisiana -- Government relations -- To 1789.Acadians -- Nova Scotia -- History -- 18th century.Manuscripts, French -- France.Manuscrits français -- France.Acadians.Choctaw Indians -- Government relations.French colonies.Indians of North America -- Government relations.Colonies -- Administration.Manuscripts, French.Travel.Genre/Form:                             Early works.History.Travel literature -- Louisiana -- 1729-1733.Time:                                   To 1803Geographic:                             France -- Colonies -- Administration -- History -- 18th century.France -- Government relations -- History -- 18th century.England -- Government relations -- History -- 18th century.Louisiana -- History -- To 1803.Louisiana -- Description and travel -- Early works to 1800.Angleterre -- Relations avec l'État -- Histoire -- 18e siècle.Louisiane -- Histoire -- Jusqu'à 1803.England.France.Louisiana.Nova Scotia.Note(s):                                Documents transcribed throughout in an even, secretarial hand; table of contents on leaf [1] in another, later, hand./ Four documents prefaced by marginalnotes, possibly in Malesherbes' handwriting, identifying origins of the reports./ Contemporary note, possibly added by a previous owner, on verso of leaf [2]: "De la bibliotheque de Malesherbes.Copies et extraits qu'il fit, et qui furent scrits par des secrétaires."/ Marbled paper over boards; gold-stamped brown leather spine label with title "Relation de l'Amerique."/ Illustratedbookplate of French mathematician and book collector Michel Chasles./ Forms part of the Rudy Lamont Ruggles Collection at the Newberry Library./ Bio/History:                            Frenchstatesman and minister under Louis XVI.Material Type:                          Manuscript (mss)Document Type:                          Book; Archival MaterialDate of Entry:                          20001027Update:                                 20220616Accession No:                           OCLC:                                   45243258Provider:        OCLCDatabase:                               WorldCat--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Libraries worldwide that own item: 1 Search the HOLLIS CatalogExternal Resources:                     Cite This ItemFind Items About:                       New voyage round the world4Dampier, William,max: 717Halley, Edmond,max: 504Hacke, William.15Wafer, Lionel,max: 48Wood, John,835Sharpe, Bartholomew,max:164Cowley, William Ambrosia.7Robert, A.,max: 79Title:Nouveau voyage autour du monde, :où l'on décrit en particulier l'Isthme de l'Amerique, plusieurs côtes & isles des Indes occidentales, les isles du Cap Verd, le passage par la Terre del Fuego, les côtes meridionales duChili, du Perou, & du Mexique; l'Isle de Guam, Mindanao, & des autres Philippines; les isles orientales qui sont prés [sic] de Cambodie; de la Chine; Formosa, Luc̦on, Celebes, &c. La NouvelleHollande, les Isles de Sumatra, de Nicobar, & de Sainte Helene & le Cap de Bonne Esperance. Où l'on traite des differens terroirs de tous ces pais, de leurs ports, des plantes, des fruits, & desanimaux qu'on y trouve: de leurs habitans, de leurs coûtumes, de leur religion, de leur gouvernement, de leur negoce &c. /Uniform Title:                          New voyage round the world. FrenchAuthor(s):                              Dampier, William, 1651-1715.Halley, Edmond,; 1656-1742.Hacke, William.Dampier, William,; 1651-1715. ; Voyage from Achin in Sumatra, to Tonquin, and other places in the East Indies.; French.Dampier, William,; 1651-1715. ; Voyages to the Bay of Campeachy.; French.Dampier, William,; 1651-1715. ; Discourse of the trade-winds, breezes, storms, seasons of the year, tides and currents of the torrid zone throughout the world.; French.Wafer, Lionel,; 1660?-1705? ; New voyage and description of the isthmus of America.; French.Wood, John,; Captain. ; Voyage thro' the Streights of Magellan.; French.Sharpe, Bartholomew,; active 1679-1682. ; Journal of his expedition.; French.Cowley, William Ambrosia. ; Voyage round the globe.; French.Robert, A.,; active 17th century. ; Voyage to the Levant.; French.Corp Author(s):                         Freres Perisse (Lyon, France) ; (Former owner)Publication:                            A Amsterdam : Chez la veuve de Paul Marret, marchand libraire dans le Beurs-Straat à la Renommée,Edition:                                Troisiéme [sic] edition revûe, corrigée & augmentée d'une volume.Place:                                  Netherlands; Amsterdam.Year:                                   1711-1712Description:                            5 v. : ill., maps ; 17 cm. voyages.Shark, Baie (Austr.-Occ.) -- Découverte et exploration.Indonésie -- Descriptions et voyages.Pacifique, Océan -- Découverte et exploration.Magellan, Détroit de (Chili et Argentine) -- Descriptions et voyages.Asia -- East Indies.Atlantic Ocean -- Strait of Magellan.Australia.Brazil -- Salvador.Cabo Verde.Canary Islands.Gulf of Mexico -- Bay of Campeche.Indian Ocean -- Shark Bay.Indonesia.Latin America.Mexico.Middle East.Pacific Ocean.Papua New Guinea.West Indies.Identifier:                             Imprint 1711.; Imprint 1712.Note(s):                                A collected issue, with additions, of William Dampier's voyages, first printed in English in four separate volumes, London, 1697 to 1709, and first printed infour separate volumes in French, Amsterdam by Paul Marret, 1698-1705./ Volumes 1-4 are printed in 1711; vol. 5 printed in 1712./ Volume 1 has added, illustrated title page reading: Voyage au tour[sic] du monde, with imprint: A Amsterdam, chez la veuve be [sic] Paul Marret, 1711; vol. 2 has added, illustrated title page reading: Voyage au tour [sic] du monde, with imprint: A Amsterdam, chezPaul Maret./ Volume 1 and vol. 2, part 1 of this collected issue comprise the author's A new voyage round the world, vol. 1, first printed London, 1697. The first French edition of vol. 1 was printedin Amsterdam, 1698./ Title page of vol. 2 reads: "Suite du voyage autour du monde, avec un Traité des vents qui regnent dans toute la zone torride" and has identical imprint as that of title pageof vol. 1./ Volume 2, part 1, p. 1-227, 2nd count, continues the author's Nouveau voyage autour du monde, vol. 1, first printed in English, 1697 and first printed in two volumes in French inAmsterdam, 1698./ "Traité des vents alisez ou reglez, des vents frais de mer & de terre, des tempêtes, des saisons de l'année, des marées, & de courans de toute la zone torride", v. 2, p.[1]-104, [4], 4th and 5th counts, has separate dated title page and imprint reading: A Amsterdam: chez Paul Marret, 1701. This is a translation of "Discourse of the trade-winds, breezes, storms,seasons of the year, tides and currents of the torrid zone throughout the world", which first appeared as part 3 in the author's New voyage round the world, vol. 2, first printed London, 1699 undertitle: "Voyages and descriptions"/ "Traité des vents alisez ou reglez" was printed at the end of vol. 2 in the second edition of vol. 1 of the author's Nouveau voyage autour du monde, printed byPaul Marret in Amsterdam, 1701 and is here included with the same sheets as the second edition. Engraved illustration of the winds with the cardinal directions and a ship is leaf 2A1./ Title page ofvol. 3 reads: "Suplement [sic] du Voyage autour du monde, contenant une description d'Achin, ville de Sumatra, du royaume de Tonquin & autres places des Indes, & de la Baye de Campeche. Où il esttraité des differens terroirs tous ce païs, de leurs ports, des plantes, des fruits, & des animaux qu'on y trouve: de leurs habitans, de leurs coûtumes, de leur religion, de leur gouvernement,de leur negoce &c. Enrichi de cartes & figures en taille douce" and has identical imprint as that of title page of vol. 1./ "Suplement [sic] du Voyage autour du monde" is a translation of parts 1 and2 of: Voyages and descriptions, first printed London, 1699, which comprises volume 2 of the author's A new voyage round the world, and which was first printed in French in 1701; wanting part 3entitled "Traité des vents alisez ou reglez, des vents frais de mer & de terre, des tempêtes, des saisons de l'année, des marées, & de courans de toute la zone torride" which is a translationof "Discourse of the trade-winds, breezes, storms, seasons of the year, tides and currents of the torrid zone throughout the world" and is here printed at the end of vol. 2 in this collection./ Titlepage of vol. 4 reads: "Voyage de Guillaume Dampier, aux terres australes, a la Nouvelle Hollande, &c. fait en 1699. Où l'on trouve la description des Isles Canaries, des isles de Mayo & de S. Jago;de la Baye de Tous les Saints, des forts & de la ville de Bahia dans le Bresil, &c. Avec le voyage de Lionel Wafer, où l'on trouve la description de l'Isthme de Darien dans l'Amerique, &c." and hasidentical imprint as that of title page of vol. 1./ "Voyage de Guillaume Dampier, aux terres australes, a la Nouvelle Hollande, &c. fait en 1699" is a translation of "A voyage to New Holland, &c. inthe year 1699" first printed London, 1703 and first printed in French by Paul Marret, Amsterdam 1705. This work, without the addition of Wafer's A new voyage and description of the Isthmus ofAmerica, comprises vol. 3 of the author's A new voyage round the world./ "Voyage de Guillaume Dampier, aux terres australes, a la Nouvelle Hollande, & c fait en 1699", v. 4, p. [1]-20 and 1-130, 1stand 2nd counts, has a preface written by Edmund Halley on p. 16-20, 1st count/ "Voyage de Mr. Wafer, où l'on trouve la description de l'Isthme de l'Amerique", p. [131]-274, has divisional titlepage, and is a translation of "A new voyage and description of the Isthmus of America" first printed London, 1699./ Title page of vol. 5 reads: "Voyage de Guillaume Dampier aux terres australes, a laNouvelle Hollande, &c. Où l'on a joint I. Le voyage du Capitaine Wood à travers le détroit de Magellan, &c. II. Le journal de l'expedition du Capitaine Sharp. III. Le voyage autour du monde duCapitaine Cowley: & IV. Le voyage du Levant de Mr. Robert. Avec diverses cartes & figures" and has imprint: A Amsterdam, chez la veuve de Paul Marret, 1712./ "Voyage de Guillaume Dampier aux terresaustrales, a la Nouvelle Hollande, &c." is a translation of "A continuation of a voyage to New-Holland, &c. in the year 1699" first printed London, 1709 and appearing in French here for the firsttime/ The translations of the voyages of Wood, Sharpe, Cowley, and Roberts included in vol. 5 are from A collection of original voyages / edited by William Hacke, first printed London, 1699 and areadditions to Dampier's A new voyage round round the world, vols. I-IV./ "Suite du Voyage de Guillaume Dampier aux terres australes, à la Nouvelles Hollande, &c. fait en 1699", p. 1-138, 2nd count,has separate caption title./ "Voyage du Capitaine Wood à travers le détroit de Magellan, &c.", p. 139-176, 2nd count, has separate caption title./ "Journal de l'expedition du Capitaine Sharp", p.177-210, 2nd count, has separate caption title/ "Voyage du Capitaine Cowley autour du monde", p. [211]-252, 2nd count, has divisional title page/ "Voyage du Levant de Mr. Robert", p. [253]-303, 2ndcount, has divisional title page/ Pagination: v. 1: [12], 340 p., [6] leaves of plates (4 folded); v. 2: [4], 227, [1], 104, [4] p., [8] leaves of plates (4 folded); v. 3: [14], 351, [41] p., [5]folded leaves of plates; v. 4: 20, 274, [14] p., [15] leaves of plates (14 folded); v. 5: [4], 303, [17] p., [26] leaves of plates (25 folded)./ Signatures: v. 1: pi1 (pi1 recto blank) *⁶ ( -⁸6)A-O¹² (F6 missigned E6) P²; v. 2: pi² (pi1 recto, pi2 verso blank) A-I¹² K⁶ (K6 verso blank) 2A-2D¹² (2A1, 2A2 versos blank) 2E⁶; v. 3: pi1 (pi1 verso blank) *⁶ A-O¹² (F7 missignedE7) P⁸ (P8 verso blank) a¹² b⁸; v. 4: *¹⁰ (*1 verso blank) A-M¹² (F6 verso blank); v. 5: pi² (pi1 verso blank) A-M¹² (I10, L7 versos blank) N¹⁰ O⁶/ Includes indexes./ Errata: v. 4,p. 274; v. 5, [1], 3rd count./ Title pages printed in red and black; woodcut head and tail pieces; initials.Class Descriptors:                       Dewey: D711Other Titles:                           Voyage autour du mondeResponsibility:                         Par Guillaume Dampier.Document Type:                          BookEntry:                                  20110629Update:                                 20220411Accession No:                           OCLC:                                   1238116474Provider:        OCLCDatabase:                               WorldCat--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[253]-303, 2ndcount, has divisional title page/ Pagination: v. 1: [12], 340 p., [6] leaves of plates (4 folded); v. 2: [4], 227, [1], 104, [4] p., [8] leaves of plates (4 folded); v. 3: [14], 351, [41] p., [5]folded leaves of plates; v. 4: 20, 274, [14] p., [15] leaves of plates (14 folded); v. 5: [4], 303, [17] p., [26] leaves of plates (25 folded)./ Signatures: v. 1: pi1 (pi1 recto blank) *⁶ ( -⁸6)A-O¹² (F6 missigned E6) P²; v. 2: pi² (pi1 recto, pi2 verso blank) A-I¹² K⁶ (K6 verso blank) 2A-2D¹² (2A1, 2A2 versos blank) 2E⁶; v. 3: pi1 (pi1 verso blank) *⁶ A-O¹² (F7 missignedE7) P⁸ (P8 verso blank) a¹² b⁸; v. 4: *¹⁰ (*1 verso blank) A-M¹² (F6 verso blank); v. 5: pi² (pi1 verso blank) A-M¹² (I10, L7 versos blank) N¹⁰ O⁶/ Includes indexes./ Errata: v. 4,p. 274; v. 5, [1], 3rd count./ Title pages printed in red and black; woodcut head and tail pieces; initials.
column11: A collected issue, with additions, of William Dampier's voyages, first printed in English in four separate volumes, London, 1697 to 1709, and first printed infour separate volumes in French, Amsterdam by Paul Marret, 1698-1705./ Volumes 1-4 are printed in 1711; vol. 5 printed in 1712./ Volume 1 has added, illustrated title page reading: Voyage au tour[sic] du monde, with imprint: A Amsterdam, chez la veuve be [sic] Paul Marret, 1711; vol. 2 has added, illustrated title page reading: Voyage au tour [sic] du monde, with imprint: A Amsterdam, chezPaul Maret./ Volume 1 and vol. 2, part 1 of this collected issue comprise the author's A new voyage round the world, vol. 1, first printed London, 1697. The first French edition of vol. 1 was printedin Amsterdam, 1698./ Title page of vol. 2 reads: "Suite du voyage autour du monde, avec un Traité des vents qui regnent dans toute la zone torride" and has identical imprint as that of title pageof vol. 1./ Volume 2, part 1, p. 1-227, 2nd count, continues the author's Nouveau voyage autour du monde, vol. 1, first printed in English, 1697 and first printed in two volumes in French inAmsterdam, 1698./ "Traité des vents alisez ou reglez, des vents frais de mer & de terre, des tempêtes, des saisons de l'année, des marées, & de courans de toute la zone torride", v. 2, p.[1]-104, [4], 4th and 5th counts, has separate dated title page and imprint reading: A Amsterdam: chez Paul Marret, 1701. This is a translation of "Discourse of the trade-winds, breezes, storms,seasons of the year, tides and currents of the torrid zone throughout the world", which first appeared as part 3 in the author's New voyage round the world, vol. 2, first printed London, 1699 undertitle: "Voyages and descriptions"/ "Traité des vents alisez ou reglez" was printed at the end of vol. 2 in the second edition of vol. 1 of the author's Nouveau voyage autour du monde, printed byPaul Marret in Amsterdam, 1701 and is here included with the same sheets as the second edition. Engraved illustration of the winds with the cardinal directions and a ship is leaf 2A1./ Title page ofvol. 3 reads: "Suplement [sic] du Voyage autour du monde, contenant une description d'Achin, ville de Sumatra, du royaume de Tonquin & autres places des Indes, & de la Baye de Campeche. Où il esttraité des differens terroirs tous ce païs, de leurs ports, des plantes, des fruits, & des animaux qu'on y trouve: de leurs habitans, de leurs coûtumes, de leur religion, de leur gouvernement,de leur negoce &c. Enrichi de cartes & figures en taille douce" and has identical imprint as that of title page of vol. 1./ "Suplement [sic] du Voyage autour du monde" is a translation of parts 1 and2 of: Voyages and descriptions, first printed London, 1699, which comprises volume 2 of the author's A new voyage round the world, and which was first printed in French in 1701; wanting part 3entitled "Traité des vents alisez ou reglez, des vents frais de mer & de terre, des tempêtes, des saisons de l'année, des marées, & de courans de toute la zone torride" which is a translationof "Discourse of the trade-winds, breezes, storms, seasons of the year, tides and currents of the torrid zone throughout the world" and is here printed at the end of vol. 2 in this collection./ Titlepage of vol. 4 reads: "Voyage de Guillaume Dampier, aux terres australes, a la Nouvelle Hollande, &c. fait en 1699. Où l'on trouve la description des Isles Canaries, des isles de Mayo & de S. Jago;de la Baye de Tous les Saints, des forts & de la ville de Bahia dans le Bresil, &c. Avec le voyage de Lionel Wafer, où l'on trouve la description de l'Isthme de Darien dans l'Amerique, &c." and hasidentical imprint as that of title page of vol. 1./ "Voyage de Guillaume Dampier, aux terres australes, a la Nouvelle Hollande, &c. fait en 1699" is a translation of "A voyage to New Holland, &c. inthe year 1699" first printed London, 1703 and first printed in French by Paul Marret, Amsterdam 1705. This work, without the addition of Wafer's A new voyage and description of the Isthmus ofAmerica, comprises vol. 3 of the author's A new voyage round the world./ "Voyage de Guillaume Dampier, aux terres australes, a la Nouvelle Hollande, & c fait en 1699", v. 4, p. [1]-20 and 1-130, 1stand 2nd counts, has a preface written by Edmund Halley on p. 16-20, 1st count/ "Voyage de Mr. Wafer, où l'on trouve la description de l'Isthme de l'Amerique", p. [131]-274, has divisional titlepage, and is a translation of "A new voyage and description of the Isthmus of America" first printed London, 1699./ Title page of vol. 5 reads: "Voyage de Guillaume Dampier aux terres australes, a laNouvelle Hollande, &c. Où l'on a joint I. Le voyage du Capitaine Wood à travers le détroit de Magellan, &c. II. Le journal de l'expedition du Capitaine Sharp. III. Le voyage autour du monde duCapitaine Cowley: & IV. Le voyage du Levant de Mr. Robert. Avec diverses cartes & figures" and has imprint: A Amsterdam, chez la veuve de Paul Marret, 1712./ "Voyage de Guillaume Dampier aux terresaustrales, a la Nouvelle Hollande, &c." is a translation of "A continuation of a voyage to New-Holland, &c. in the year 1699" first printed London, 1709 and appearing in French here for the firsttime/ The translations of the voyages of Wood, Sharpe, Cowley, and Roberts included in vol. 5 are from A collection of original voyages / edited by William Hacke, first printed London, 1699 and areadditions to Dampier's A new voyage round round the world, vols. I-IV./ "Suite du Voyage de Guillaume Dampier aux terres australes, à la Nouvelles Hollande, &c. fait en 1699", p. 1-138, 2nd count,has separate caption title./ "Voyage du Capitaine Wood à travers le détroit de Magellan, &c.", p. 139-176, 2nd count, has separate caption title./ "Journal de l'expedition du Capitaine Sharp", p.177-210, 2nd count, has separate caption title/ "Voyage du Capitaine Cowley autour du monde", p. [211]-252, 2nd count, has divisional title page/ "Voyage du Levant de Mr. Robert", p. [253]-303, 2ndcount, has divisional title page/ Pagination: v. 1: [12], 340 p., [6] leaves of plates (4 folded); v. 2: [4], 227, [1], 104, [4] p., [8] leaves of plates (4 folded); v. 3: [14], 351, [41] p., [5]folded leaves of plates; v. 4: 20, 274, [14] p., [15] leaves of plates (14 folded); v. 5: [4], 303, [17] p., [26] leaves of plates (25 folded)./ Signatures: v. 1: pi1 (pi1 recto blank) *⁶ ( -⁸6)A-O¹² (F6 missigned E6) P²; v. 2: pi² (pi1 recto, pi2 verso blank) A-I¹² K⁶ (K6 verso blank) 2A-2D¹² (2A1, 2A2 versos blank) 2E⁶; v. 3: pi1 (pi1 verso blank) *⁶ A-O¹² (F7 missignedE7) P⁸ (P8 verso blank) a¹² b⁸; v. 4: *¹⁰ (*1 verso blank) A-M¹² (F6 verso blank); v. 5: pi² (pi1 verso blank) A-M¹² (I10, L7 versos blank) N¹⁰ O⁶/ Includes indexes./ Errata: v. 4,p. 274; v. 5, [1], 3rd count./ Title pages printed in red and black; woodcut head and tail pieces; initials.

Libraries worldwide that own item: 1 Search the HOLLIS CatalogExternal Resources:                     Cite This ItemFind Items About:                       Dampier, William,max: 717Title:Nouveau voyage autour du monde.Où l'on décrit en particulier l'isthme de l'Amerique, plusieurs côtes & isles des Indes Occidentales, les isles du Cap Verd, le passage par la Terre del Fuego, les côtes meridionales duChili, du Perou, & du Mexique; l'isle de Guam, Mindanoa, & des autres Philippines; les isles orientales qui sont près de Cambodie, de la Chine, Formosa, Luçon, Celebes, &c. la Nouvelle Hollande,les isles de Sumatra, de Nicobar, de Sainte Helene, & le Cap de Bonne-Esperance ...Author(s):                              Dampier, William, 1651-1715.Publication:                            A Rouen, Chez Jean-Baptiste Machuel,Year:                                   1714Description:                            5 volumes plates, maps (some folded) 17 cmLanguage:                               FrenchSUBJECT(S)Descriptor:                             Voyages around the world.Voyages and travels.Buccaneers.Winds.Tides.Voyages autour du monde.Voyages.Boucaniers.Vents.Marées.journeys.tides.Buccaneers.Tides.Travel.Voyages and travels.Voyages around the world.Winds.Geographic:                             Latin America -- Description and travel.Amérique latine -- Descriptions et voyages.Latin America.Note(s):                                Title vignettes. Tome II./ Vol. 3 has title: Suplement du Voyage autour du monde. Contenant une description d'Achin, ville de Sumatra, du royaume de Tonquin & autres placesdes Indes, & de la Baye de Campêche ... Tome III./ Vols. 4-5 have title: Voyage aux terres australes, à la Nouvelle Hollande, &c., fait en 1699 ... (XII, 231, [1 cz.] s., [1] k. map ; 148 s.) ; 4°.Language:                               French; P. 1 - tekst równolegle w jęz. fr. wraz z tekstem w jęz. łac., ang. (Periplus Wulfstani ex Hormesta Alfredi), niem. (Chronicon Thuringicum),pol. (Kronika polska M. Stryjkowskiego), ros. (Povest' vremiennych let).References:                             Estr. XV-XVIII,; 25, 138.; NKor,; 6/1, 71.Note(s):                                Nazw. druk. wg Pisarze polskiego oświecenia. T. 2 / pod redakcją Teresy Kostkiewiczowej i Zbigniewa Golińskiego. - Warszawa, 1994 s. 427./ Na s. tyt.data: M. DCC. XC. III./ Na s. tyt. P. 1: Chroniques Et Memoires, Tome I. Comprenant La Fin Du Neuvieme Siecle; na s. tyt. P. 2: Chroniques Et Memoires, Livre XLII. Seconde Partie./ W P. 1 mapa:"Carte Cyclographique De La Sarmatie pour l'année 900 de l'Ere Chretienne" sygn. gravé par Martinet./ P. 1 składa się 11 rozdziałów obejmujących fragmenty następujących kronik:Chronicon Poloniae (s. 2-11); Jana Długosza, Annales (s. 12-17); Galla Anonima, Chronicon (s. 18-37); Wincentego Kadłubka, Chronica Polonorum (s. 38-65); Kosmasa, Chronica Boemorum (s. 66-93);Chronicon Thuringicum (s. 94-99); Helmoldusa, Chronica Slavorum (s. 100-133); Paulusa Orosiusa, Adversus paganos (tekst zatytułowany Periplus Wulfstani, s. 134-139); Petrusa de Dusburg, Chroniconterrae Prussiae (s. 140-149); Macieja Stryjkowskiego, Kronika polska, litewska, żmudzka [...] (s. 150-175) oraz Povest' vremiennych let zredagowana przez Nestora (s.176-231)./ Chronicon Poloniae(znany także pod tytułami łacińskimi: Chronica Regni Poloniae, Annalia vetustae gentis Polonorum vel Slavonicae, Chronica longa seu magna Polonorum seu Lechitarum i tytułem polskim: Kronikawielkopolska) wg Brygidy Kürbis przypisywany jest Boguchwałowi, biskupowi poznańskiemu, Godysławowi Baszko lub Janowi z Czarnkowa (Kronika wielkopolska / przekład Kazimierz Abgarowicz ;wstęp i komentarze Brygida Kürbis. - Kraków, 2010 s. 19-23)./ Fragment tekstu zatytułowany "Periplus Wulfstani ex Hormesta Alfredi" ("Voyage de Wulfstan, tire de L'Hormesta du roi Alfred")poświęcony podróży Wulfstana po Morzu Bałtyckim został dodany do tekstu książki Paulusa Orosiusa, "Adversus paganos" przez króla Alfreda Wielkiego./ P. 2 składa się z 9rozdziałów (XII-XX) obejmujących m. in. fragmenty tekstów: Liutprandusa z Cremony, Histoire des rois et des empereurs de l'Europe (s. [2]-32); Annales de Fulde (s. 33-53); Histoire des septpremiers ducs Hongrois (Gesta Hungarorum) Anonimowego notariusza króla Beli (s. 84-146) oraz kroniki Enrico Dandolo./ W P. 2 błędne oznaczenie numerów rozdziałów.Other Titles:                           Kronika wielkopolska; (łac., fr ;; fragment); Povest' vremennyh let; (fr., ros. ;; fragment); Annales Fuldenses; (fr. ;; fragment); Gesta Hungarorum, anonim;(fr. ;; fragment); Chronicon Poloniae.; Chronicon Thuringicum.; Povest' vremennych let.; Annales de Fulde.; Histoire des sept premiers ducs Hongrois.Responsibility:                         Par Le Comte Jean Potockj, Livre XLII. Comprenant la fin du neuvieme siecle de notre Ere.Document Type:                          BookEntry:                                  20131014Update:                                 20180708Accession No:                           OCLC:                                   869907650Provider:        OCLCDatabase:                               WorldCat--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

FrenchAuthor(s):                              Dampier, William, 1651-1715.Publication:                            A Rouen : Chez Eustache Herault,Year:                                   1715Description:                            5 volumes ; 12moLanguage:                               FrenchNote(s):                                Volume two - the "Traité des vents" has seperate half-title; volume five - pagination irregular. With additional title pages, engraved, to tomes 1-2./ Titlesvary. Volume one continues: "où l'on décrit en particulier l'isthme de l'Amerique, plusieurs côtes & isles des Indes occidentales ... [etc.]"; volume two is titled "Suite du voyage autour dumonde" and continues "avec un traité des vents qui régnent dans toute la zone torride"; volume three is titled "Suplement du voyage autour du monde" and continues "contenant une descriptiond'Achin, ville de Sumatra, du royaume de Tonquin & autres places des Indes, & de la Baye de Campêche"; volumes four and five are titled "Voyage aux terres Australes, à la NouvelleHolland"--Volume four continues "où l'on trouve la description des isles Canaries, des isles de Mayo & de S. Jago ... avec le voyage de Lionel Wafer ... [etc.]", volume five continues "où l'on ajoint I. Le voyage du Capitaine Wood à travers le détroit de Magellan, &c. II. Le journal de l'expedition du Capitaine Sharp. III. Le voyage autour du monde du Captain Cowley. IV. Le voyage duLevant de Mr. Robert."Other Titles:                           Suite du voyage autour du monde.; Suplement du voyage autour du monde.; Voyage aux terres Australes.Responsibility:                         par Guillaume Dampier. Enrichi de cartes & figures.Document Type:                          BookEntry:                                  20200818Update:                                 20220117Accession No:                           OCLC:                                   1184203068Provider:        OCLCDatabase:                               WorldCat--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Ensemble une description exacte des terres & provinces que possedent les Espagnols en toutel'Amerique, de la forme de leur gouvernement ecclésiastique & politique, de leur commerce, de leurs moeurs, & de celles des creoles, des metifs [sic], des mulatres, des Indiens, & des negres.Uniform Title:                          English-American.
